qas.question: What country did Nasser want to be the leader of the Arab world?
What two disparate ideologies was Nasser trying to unite?
What religious group did Nasser endeavor to reform?
What religious group was Nasser seeking to marginalize?

context: In 1961, Nasser sought to firmly establish <a0_0>Egypt<a0_0/> as the leader of the Arab world and to promote a second revolution in Egypt with the purpose of merging <a1_0>Islamic and socialist<a1_0/> thinking. To achieve this, he initiated several reforms to modernize <a2_0>al-Azhar<a2_0/>, which serves as the de facto leading authority in Sunni Islam, and to ensure its prominence over the <a3_0>Muslim Brotherhood<a3_0/> and the more conservative Wahhabism promoted by Saudi Arabia. Nasser had used al-Azhar's most willing ulema (scholars) as a counterweight to the Brotherhood's Islamic influence, starting in 1953.
